item.title: John G. Paton's 200th Birthday, Hudson Taylor vs John Paton, Toby Sumpter's Paton Talk [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to today’s bonus episode of the China Compass Podcast!

Happy 200th Birthday to John G. Paton!

Tears for Tanna: The Perseverance of John G. Paton and the Transformation of Tanna

The autobiography of the “King of the Cannibals” who lost everything but his life during his first few years on the forsaken island of Tanna. I reformatted and edited this classic book, which was officially released on May 24, 2024, John G. Paton’s 200th birthday.

JohnGPaton.com

In this episode, I discuss the following and more...

  • John Paton vs Hudson Taylor 
  • My first exposure to Paton's story
  • How I came to republish Paton's original autobiography

*Special thanks to Toby Sumpter for his talk on John G. Paton at the Christ Church Missions Conference (Download on the ChristKirk App), and for writing the Foreword to Tears for Tanna.

item.title: Tibet vs Gaza, the Dalai Lama, and the Forbidden Land [China Compass]
item.description:
On this edition of the CCP, Ben discusses the “deportation” of Chinese illegals and a recent article comparing Tibet with Gaza (6:01). Next he introduces Tibet (14:30). News about the Dalai Lama comes next (16:31), followed by fascinating stories (21:40) of four (illegal) visits to the Forbidden Land. Finally, he gives a quick intro to the Tibetan language (42:38) and shares a couple of book recommendations.

item.description:

item.title: Gansu, Shocking Story, and more SARS [China Compass]
item.description:
On this CCP, Ben mentions “the other CCP” before laying out plans for this podcast. He then introduces Gansu Province (8:00), where he lived, raised a family, but was eventually kicked out of.

He also tells the shocking story behind the title of his book Unbeaten (12:22), of his Gansu friends who suffered through a major earthquake, and shares about comical checkpoint scenes during SARS in 2003 (27:02).

Finally, he ends with a China Compass Q&A on the Chinese Church. (33:06)

item.title: China 101, Taiwan, and Surviving SARS [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to the first episode of the China Compass Podcast (CCP)!

Missionary Ben (Pen Name: B.F. Westen) introduces himself and shares why he is qualified to talk about China.

Then he dives into China 101 (9:02), answering foundational questions about China’s name, size, geography, peoples, and language.

After introducing Pray for China (19:50), he gives an overview of China’s outlying regions (24:42) (Taiwan, Hong Kong/Puerto Rico, and Macau) and his experiences there (34:00), including surviving SARS in 2003.
